title: JunaidAzizi
author: JunaidAzizi
content: BITCOIN AND NUMEROLOGY:SECRETS OF NUMBERSDid you guys think for a while that digits have their meanings or beliefs? Maybe many of you didn't think about it because we just see digits and nothing more, nor were we even guided by someone. In today's post, I will tell you about the beliefs or meanings behind the digits.>NUMEROLOGY  Well, numerology simply means the secret meaning or code in a number. People usually think that every number has its own special meanings, which can influence our lives, events, and the things surrounding us. According to the study, numbers are not just used for counting but carry some meanings and symbols. For example, the number 1 in numerology is associated with wealth, and the number 8 means success.The interesting thing is that this numerology is not a modern-day invention but has been used for many years, starting before the medieval ages and happening in today's time.> Numerology and Bitcoin.This post is about Bitcoin. We can use numerology in many aspects of life, but in this post, I will only focus on Bitcoin to explore what numerology says about it and whether this relates to Bitcoin or not. I checked it and was wondering after examining it. Numbers like 21 million, 69,000 ATH, the Bitcoin genesis block, the halving event, and the name Satoshi itself have some meanings. You may see them as digits or letters, but numerology sees them differently. Before going into it, here is a chart sheet of Bitcoin events, their numbers, meanings, and connections with Bitcoin..Chart Sheet> Numerology and Bitcoin Examples> Satoshi Nakamoto Name CodeStarting from the founder of Bitcoin, Satoshi Nakamoto. First, his name is in letters, so we can assign digits to letters, like 1 for A, 2 for B, and so on. The pictures below show the numerology math of Satoshi's name.As you can see, his number is 1, which means in numerology a leader or pioneer. Nothing is hidden from the world, Bitcoin was created by Satoshi Nakamoto, the founder and leader of Bitcoin. You can see how these digits correctly show the meanings behind them. Now, let's move on to another example.> Bitcoin Total Supply (21 million)In the picture, the result for the total supply is 3, which represents creativity and growth in numerology. Satoshi set a total supply for Bitcoin at 21 million, and millions of Bitcoins have been mined, with only a few left to be mined soon. This total supply is fixed, but the Bitcoin price increases every year, especially after halving, which reduces the supply and increases demand and price,  which eventually help bitcoin growth> New ATHLet's check what numerology says about Bitcoin's new ATH of 109, let's break it down in numerology.The ATH number is 4, and in numerology, 4 represents stability, structure, and hard work. We know the 100k milestone was very hard, but Bitcoin surpassed it and reached 109k, which shows its stability and strength as an asset. This number also reflects that the Bitcoin community is doing their hard work for the betterment of Bitcoin and has a structure of blockchain that is more transparent than ever before.> Genesis Block Date  The next one is the genesis block date, which is January 3, 2009. Everyone knows the history of this date; let's go to its numerological mathematics.The number is 6, which means in numerology it represents fairness and balance. Bitcoin was created by Satoshi to bring balance to money, eliminating banks and the centralization of money. Instead, the user controls his or her money. The aim of this system is to create a fair and decentralized system. Everyone can track the transaction, and the price will not be controlled by a single entity. Bitcoin was responsible as it started to empower users to have control over their own money, not by others..The post is related to Bitcoin, so the main focus is on Bitcoin events and related topics. However, you can also calculate your birthday date to learn about your personality. The calculation is simple, you have to add the numbers, and when the result is a two-digit number, reduce it to one digit. Then, check it against the ideas behind that number. There are three numbers known as master numbers, if your result is 11, 22, or 33, then it is a master number, and you should not reduce it to one digit. If you know some more interesting things about Bitcoin, please share them here to see what numerology says about it. The discussion is open for all, and your responses will be appreciated with respect and dignity.Source: All the images are made through the Canva application, and the information on numerology is taken from here, while Bitcoin information is sourced from here.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Interesting to know about these, so numbers actually have their own way of interpretation and we can still relate these interpretations to a meaning creativity in bitcoin network, i must confess that if you're the one that come up with these, then you have done very well in taking time to sum them up to a meaningful interpretation, but i think you already make a reference to them, i like the way the word sound and appears meaningful.

comments.author: JunaidAzizi
comments.body: Quote from: Dunamisx on February 14, 2025, 08:11:09 PMInteresting to know about these, so numbers actually have their own way of interpretation and we can still relate these interpretations to a meaning creativity in bitcoin network, i must confess that if you're the one that come up with these, then you have done very well in taking time to sum them up to a meaningful interpretation, but i think you already make a reference to them, i like the way the word sound and appears meaningful.Yeah, this is so interesting. Numbers have their meanings as well. From my childhood, I just used numbers for counting and many more things. Many are not aware of this, but when I heard about numerology, that every number has its own meaning, I was wondering at that moment and applied it to my birthday date. You won't believe it, the meanings tell about my birthday number, and I relate to it 70% with my qualities. Then I came up with the idea that I would be very curious if I applied it to Bitcoin. I used Bitcoin events for it, and the results are in the post you can check.The reason for giving reference means I take the meanings of numbers from there, and the idea of using those numbers' meanings on Bitcoin and its events is my own. I’m not aware if someone has worked on it before. I bring this information here, which is very interesting and debatable, but it seems like no one is showing interest in my post, and that's why it has been ignored by the community.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: JunaidAzizi on February 14, 2025, 06:43:13 PMLet's check what numerology says about Bitcoin's new ATH of 109, let's break it down in numerology.https://www.talkimg.com/images/2025/02/14/qurqg.pngI'm a little bit confused with the middle part... How is "6+9+9+6" related to the new ATH?- FWIW, I'm among those who don't believe in such things, but I did enjoy reading your thread and want to dig deeper if I can find an easier source than the one you linked in the opening post (somehow is confusing me).Quote from: JunaidAzizi on February 14, 2025, 06:43:13 PMIf you know some more interesting things about Bitcoin, please share them here to see what numerology says about it.I found a few more in the following article, but I haven't cross-checked them yet: Bitcoin Numerology

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Personally speaking, I don't really gave a taste for astrology and things that give special meanings to numbers outside the mathematical and theory realms. Because none of it really makes sense to talk about if the markets don't follow such terminogy.It can't predict when such an ATH will be accomplished for example.

comments.author: Jating
comments.body: If we are talking about numerology though, and if Satoshi can relate to it, then as you have said, it should be the number 8.But it's not, the lifepath of Bitcoin is so very different, 6? I do not think that Bitcoin will bring balance, I mean have you set that it has been under attack for many years and there are government that is against, so there is no balance after all.Most likely, everything is just coincidence.

And in people they call it life path numbers, and here it was shown by the OP but adopt it to Bitcoin.Quote from: SFR10 on February 15, 2025, 06:47:17 PMQuote from: JunaidAzizi on February 14, 2025, 06:43:13 PMLet's check what numerology says about Bitcoin's new ATH of 109, let's break it down in numerology.https://www.talkimg.com/images/2025/02/14/qurqg.pngI'm a little bit confused with the middle part... How is "6+9+9+6" related to the new ATH?- FWIW, I'm among those who don't believe in such things, but I did enjoy reading your thread and want to dig deeper if I can find an easier source than the one you linked in the opening post (somehow is confusing me).Yes, I try to look at where the gets the number, but his source is coinmarketcap, $109,114.88.So it should be 1+0+9+1+1+4+8+8=32. 3+2=5. And number 5 is considered a good luck number and a "master of change".

comments.author: woez
comments.body: I just look at the main vision of the founders and it was about decentralizing finance, removing bank control, and returning financial power to individuals to be transparent and fair because it was predicted that if there was no other option, then BTC was born as another option that could break that dependence and if I'm not mistaken the Bitcoin Genesis Block was first mined around January 3, 2009 which is numerologically abbreviated to 6.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: I consider numerology as pseudoscience, although i don't mind people having fun talk about it.Quote from: JunaidAzizi on February 14, 2025, 06:43:13 PM> Satoshi Nakamoto Name CodeStarting from the founder of Bitcoin, Satoshi Nakamoto. First, his name is in letters, so we can assign digits to letters, like 1 for A, 2 for B, and so on. The pictures below show the numerology math of Satoshi's name.If i want to use full name, which approach should i use?1. Count "Satoshi" and "Nakamoto" separately?Code:19+1+20+15+19+8+9=919+1=1010=1+0=1Code:14+1+11+1+13+15+20+15=909+0=92. Count "Satoshi Nakamoto" together?Code:19+1+20+15+19+8+9+14+1+11+1+13+15+20+15=181181=1+8+1=1010=1+0=1

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: I have the point of view of numerology being a complete pseudoscience and thus anything and everything that it comes up to with, I take with a bunch of salt.Not to make the OP feel bad, but bitcoin is based on science and OP should read about pseudoscience and how it wrongly influences people to do the wrong things and spread misinformation.Things might look good with numerology if you are cherry picking certain good "numbers" - but a number of bad numbers might also exist which have been overlooked.

comments.author: peter0425
comments.body: Quote from: JunaidAzizi on February 14, 2025, 06:43:13 PM> Genesis Block Date  The next one is the genesis block date, which is January 3, 2009. Everyone knows the history of this date; let's go to its numerological mathematics.The number is 6, which means in numerology it represents fairness and balance. Bitcoin was created by Satoshi to bring balance to money, eliminating banks and the centralization of money. Instead, the user controls his or her money. The aim of this system is to create a fair and decentralized system. Everyone can track the transaction, and the price will not be controlled by a single entity. Bitcoin was responsible as it started to empower users to have control over their own money, not by others..I salute you for taking the time to do all of these. It seemed like it took massive time and effort. However, I do not believe in numerology. To me it is too superstitious and does not really contribute anything to how I will live my life. I think that believing in such things will only make me paranoid since I will be making up meaning for every single thing even if there is none. If we believe in this kind of things too much, we are most likely to manipulate reality so that it fits to what we want it to be.Even without this numerology, I still believe that bitcoin and satoshi had good intentions and could bring massive benefits to anyone who use it well. Not because of superstitious beliefs but simply because I have seen what bitcoin has done and I believe in what it can do in the future.Anyway, good job for compiling this though. It seems like others are interested.

comments.author: JunaidAzizi
comments.body: Quote from: peter0425 on February 17, 2025, 11:22:02 AMI salute you for taking the time to do all of these. It seemed like it took massive time and effort. However, I do not believe in numerology. To me it is too superstitious and does not really contribute anything to how I will live my life. I think that believing in such things will only make me paranoid since I will be making up meaning for every single thing even if there is none. If we believe in this kind of things too much, we are most likely to manipulate reality so that it fits to what we want it to be.Even without this numerology, I still believe that bitcoin and satoshi had good intentions and could bring massive benefits to anyone who use it well. Not because of superstitious beliefs but simply because I have seen what bitcoin has done and I believe in what it can do in the future.Anyway, good job for compiling this though. It seems like others are interested. Thanks, mate, for your kind words and appreciation. They encourage me to bring more information and interesting things about Bitcoin here. Well, numerology is like predicting, people do it, but they are not sure about the results. The same goes for numerology, you can check the meanings and relate them to yourself, but they may not be 100% correct. In the case of Bitcoin, you see that the meaningful numbers and the agendas of Bitcoin are the same. For example, the number 1 represents a leader; Satoshi, who created Bitcoin, is number 1 and the leader of the crypto world. I didn't create these numbers and their meanings, but I check their meanings and relate them to Bitcoin, and I was wondering, so I brought up the topic here to see what people say about it.

comments.author: abramovf
comments.body: Even the name Satoshi Nakamoto is not real. Just a hypothetical name given to creator. And this numerology based calculation is giving emphasis bases on that name. So the basic itself is wrong.

comments.author: DubemIfedigbo001
comments.body: This is lovely,I kind of don't believe in these kind of psychological hacks since I'll only believe the positives and reject the negatives and I I'm not a fan of relying on psychological hacks to validate my activities.  You really took out time to organize this and it's very commendable. Although I don't really understand that part of1+0+9+6+9+9+6, the first 109 is the new ATH, the 69 is the past ATH, the 96 means what?

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: Quoteand the price will not be controlled by a single entity.I have doubts about this. The Bitcoin price cannot be controlled by any entity, but it can be heavily influenced(or maybe I should say "manipulated") by the crypto whales and the governments. Just look at what happened with Donald Trump and his "crypto reserve plan".Anyway, that's an interesting forum thread, even though I totally do not believe in numerology and astrology. What's next? Somebody making a horoscope of Satoshi Nakamoto or some other early Bitcoin developer? I don't even know Satoshi Nakamoto's birth date.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: I find it interesting how certain things just connect to male some meaning. Even though I can't make anything of this entire post, I enjoy the logic more like entertainment. Maybe we could develop a Bitcoin slangs from this way of thinking where we can speak only in numbers if that is feasible .I know this will make more sense to those who believe it astrology because they believe so much on numbers such as the amazing Fibonacci ratios.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: JunaidAzizi on February 17, 2025, 04:42:07 PMThanks, mate, for your kind words and appreciation. They encourage me to bring more information and interesting things about Bitcoin here. Well, numerology is like predicting, people do it, but they are not sure about the results. The same goes for numerology, you can check the meanings and relate them to yourself, but they may not be 100% correct. In the case of Bitcoin, you see that the meaningful numbers and the agendas of Bitcoin are the same. For example, the number 1 represents a leader; Satoshi, who created Bitcoin, is number 1 and the leader of the crypto world. I didn't create these numbers and their meanings, but I check their meanings and relate them to Bitcoin, and I was wondering, so I brought up the topic here to see what people say about it.Although I don't believe that numbers would influence people's life. Numerology is also associated with some religious or occultic practices that I don't agree with. Some of the relationships between these numbers and Bitcoin might be mere coincidence. In my tradition first child in a home is seen as the leader of the family after the demise of the father. They are expected to exhibit sound leadership skills since they are number one. However, that's not the case in many homes because some of them failed in this role. But I must commend you for this wonderful contribution. Great work.

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: Imagine that all the bitcoins have been mined.Imagine, also, that all the bitcoins have been burned or lost so that there is only one bitcoin left in the whole world.The Devs can split that one bitcoin into as many pieces as they want. They can take a satoshi, and break it into so many pieces that everybody in the world can have a piece of the one bitcoin that is left.Of course, that bitcoin would be worth an untold fortune. But spread around the world in fractions of a satoshi, there is no way that it could be controlled.There is a long way to go before we get to that point... what, more than a hundred years? But there is no worry that Bitcoin will die from loss of literal bitcoins.
